titleStmt.title: Innocency and conscientiousness of the Quakers asserted and cleared from the evil surmises, false aspersions, and unrighteous suggestions of Judge Keeling expressed in his speech made the seventh of the seventh month at the sessions-house in the Old-Baily ... : wherein also is shewed that this law doth not concern them, they being no seditious sectaries, nor contrivers of insurrections, nor evil-doers, therefore no just law is against them.
titleStmt.author: Smith, William, d. 1673.

titleStmt.title: Innocency and conscientiousness of the Quakers asserted and cleared from the evil surmises, false aspersions, and unrighteous suggestions of Judge Keeling expressed in his speech made the seventh of the seventh month at the sessions-house in the Old-Baily ... : wherein also is shewed that this law doth not concern them, they being no seditious sectaries, nor contrivers of insurrections, nor evil-doers, therefore no just law is against them.
titleStmt.author: Smith, William, d. 1673.

publicationStmt.publisher: Published by a lover of truth and righteousness, W.S.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Duke University Library.
Attributed to William Smith. cf. BM.
